title: Design sightseeing tour in London.
content:
Hello everybody.

I want to visit London for a few days and wanted to ask if there are any design or typography related places which I should visit. I will definitely visit the Tschichold exhibition at the St. Bride Libray. Therefore I have one more question: Is it possible to visit the library and look through some old books or do I have to sign on.

greetings: Steven
author: stw

comments.content: Phil Baines' [A Walking Tour of Public Typography in London](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/www.publiclettering.org.uk/)

Stephen,  
 [Type Tours](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/www.typevents.com/index.php?id=81,0,0,1,0,0) of the City of London, organised by Type Events are very good.

See also: [  
](http://web.archive.org/) [http://typophile.com/node/33877](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/typophile.com/node/33877 "http://typophile.com/node/33877")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/29958](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/typophile.com/node/29958 "http://typophile.com/node/29958")  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/timbones/sets/72157594392158650/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/timbones/sets/72157594392158650/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/timbones/sets/72157594392158650/")

BTW, the St. Bride's reading room will be closed for a while. For further information:  
 [http://stbride.org/events\_education/events/temporaryclosure](http://web.archive.org/web/20140406172439/http:/stbride.org/events_education/events/temporaryclosure "http://stbride.org/events\_education/events/temporaryclosure")

You don't have to sign in at the library. However, in my experience it is best to contact the library first if you have a specific request. Most of the collection is tucked away, as apparently the reading room contains just 7% of their collection.
